answers.answer: Are you taking thyroid replacement hormone, and if so, what are you taking?Do you know what the hormone tests showed?Your TSH indicates that you are very hyper.

Well I was taking 150,then 137 one day and150 the next [alterating] then just 137 next 125 then 112 now starting100, not real sure what the other test numbers are. I have been taking levo. but Dr. just switched me to 100 mg synthroid, tsh before was .03 but now its .04

Do you have a firm diagnosis, or are you just "hypothyroid"?Have you had an ultrasound that shows nodules?There is a reason your medication is dropping. Either you started medication in the last six months and were started on too high a dose, or there is some other reason that needs to be fleshed out.

LOL!!Well, for a minute you had three threads lined up and I took the time to read the other two.You had an ultrasound, and it came out looking complicated.Have you had a series of antibody tests run yet?When do you talk to the doctor about the results of the ultrasound?You need to find out what the Free T4 and Free T3 levels are. If those levels are low, you need to increase your med and run tests on the pituitary gland.If your Free T4 and Free T3 are high, then you are hyper and your med dosage needs to be lowered.I'm not telling you what to do with your meds. I'm telling you what your doctor should be doing with your meds.

my Dr isn't concerned at all with my sono results. don't think I've had the antibody one but will in 6 weeks because she's doing an ANTI-TPO test { i guess thats the test you were saying]  I don't know what the T4 & T3 were but was told they show hypo & TSH shows hyper....?????????????
Are you seeing an Endo?Your ultrasound is a little unusual. Whoever you are seeing, get a second opinion. Antibody tests should have been run already.Antibody tests;TPOabTGabTSIAll three.

Yes just started seeing one, she tells me she'll run this test in 6 weeks after i've been on this new dose. Not sure if Im crazy about her, she also tells me I have diabetes because she had last two lab test from family Dr and my glucose level was 126, even after I told her those numbers weren't while fasting. I went to her for the thyroid and she quickly went onto the diabetes which makes no sense to me because the number was fine for not fasting.
Some Endo's specialize in Diabetes and tend to focus on that.You may end up seeing another Endo before it's over.

question: my tsh level is .04 i have always been hypo. what's this idicating? Dr says my other levels indicate that I'm still hypo. but the pit. gland is telling the thyroid theres not enough...??????????????confusing..........what do you all think???
title: is this far off?
